channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Road surface is a disgraceful state, 15th March
item.description:
The whole section from the Hatherley Manor hotel to the A38 is very dangerous, the road surface has broken up very badly. A cyclist could easily fall off their bike and get injured and there must be numerous coil springs and burst tyres happening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hatherley Lodge Down Hatherley Lane, Down Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole road is a disgrace, very dangerous, 15th March
item.description:

item.title: Lots of pot holes near the jucntion, 15th March
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 169 Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote

item.title: Potholes at junction Greenway Lane & London Road, 15th March
item.description:
This is a duplicate report as you have erroneously marked the previous report as fixed when it's anything but. This particular pothole is over 3 months old, and is deep enough to put your whole foot in, and is on a main road. Multiple people have reported on local groups having tyre blow outs and cracked wheels. please can this be attended to as a matter of urgency!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 237b London Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light leaning, 14th March
item.description:
A disused street light (one the right in the image), that has now been replaced by a new one (one the left in the image), is still in place and leaning over by about 10-20 degrees and may eventually fall. It may have been struck by a vehicle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Cheshire Road, Innsworth
Report on FixMyStreet
